value.title: Identify principles and practices for responsible AI
value.excerpt: It is imperative to reflect on the implications of AI in business. In this learning path, you will be provided with guidelines to assist in setting up principles and a governance model in your organization. You will also be provided with resources, best practices, and tools.

topItems.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we’ve recognized six principles that we believe should guide AI development and use — fairness, reliability and safety, privacy and security, inclusiveness, transparency, and accountability. For us, these principles are the cornerstone of a responsible and trustworthy approach to AI, especially as intelligent technology becomes more prevalent in the products and services we use every day. We recognize that every individual, company, and region will have their own beliefs and standards that should be reflected in their AI journey. We want to share our perspective as you consider developing your own guiding principles.

images.title: Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

topItems.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI
topItems.excerpt: As AI becomes more prevalent, it’s imperative that organizations have governing practices in place to ensure that it’s used responsibly. Responsible use of AI starts with organizations establishing their own guiding principles, then choosing and operationalizing a system of governance. We recognize that every organization will have their own perspective on responsible AI, but we’re hopeful that our perspective will serve as a helpful starting point as others embark on their own AI journey.

images.title: Identify governing practices for responsible AI

topItems.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: At Microsoft, we have established our own governing practices for responsible AI. While every organization will have its own approach and we don’t have all the answers, we’d like to share what we’ve learned so far.

images.title: Discuss practices for responsible AI at Microsoft
Identify guiding principles for responsible AI

value.title: Implement knowledge mining with Azure Cognitive Search
value.excerpt: Do you have information locked up in structured and unstructured data sources?  Using Azure Cognitive Search, you can extract key insights from this data, and enable applications to search and analyze them.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Cognitive Search solution
topItems.excerpt: Unlock the hidden insights in your data with Azure Cognitive Search.

topItems.title: Create an enrichment pipeline with Azure Cognitive Search
topItems.excerpt: Use the power of artificial intelligence to enrich your data and find new insights.

topItems.title: Create a knowledge store with Azure Cognitive Search
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to persist the output from an Azure Cognitive Search enrichment pipeline for independent analysis or downstream processing.

value.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM Identity
value.excerpt: After completing this learning path, you’ll know how to implement identity in Azure. You’ll be able to extend an existing on-premises Active Directory identity service into Azure.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server
topItems.excerpt: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server

topItems.title: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS Active Directory domain controllers in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS active directory domain controllers in Azure

value.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM networking
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you’ll learn about Azure IaaS networking and identity. After completing the learning path, you’ll be able to implement IP addressing, manage DNS, and deploy and manage domain controllers in Azure.

topItems.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM IP addressing and routing
topItems.excerpt: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM IP addressing and routing

topItems.title: Implement DNS for Windows Server IaaS VMs
topItems.excerpt: Implement DNS for Windows Server IaaS VMs

topItems.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM network security
topItems.excerpt: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM network security

value.title: Introduction to version control with Git
value.excerpt: Git is the leading version control tool and essential for developers. Learn how to leverage Git to track your own changes and collaborate with others.

topItems.title: Introduction to Git
topItems.excerpt: Find out what source control is, and get an introduction to Git - the world's most popular version control system.

images.title: Introduction to Git

topItems.title: Collaborate with Git
topItems.excerpt: Use Git to track changes to source code and collaborate with other developers

images.title: Collaborate with Git

topItems.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
topItems.excerpt: Level up your Git knowledge by learning about how to keep code separate using branches and how to merge them later

images.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
Introduction to Git

value.title: Manage cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring it's underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.
In this learning path, you will:

Learn about virtualization and how it's used in the cloud
Know what VMs and containers are
Understand what scale, load, and common load patterns are
Know what autoscaling is and be familiar with autoscaling techniques
Learn how to automate cloud resource management with scripts
Understand the concept of infrastructure-as-code

In Partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
topItems.excerpt: Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

images.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity

topItems.title: Automate cloud resource management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about how to automate cloud resource management with scripts and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.

images.title: Automate cloud resource management

value.title: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure App Service
value.excerpt: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure App Service

topItems.title: Externalize configuration for your ASP.NET application using Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Learn how use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web application to retrieve secrets from Azure Key vault

topItems.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application, to store log data in Azure blob storage, and incorporate log information in Application Insights performance data.

topItems.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application using Azure Cache for Redis
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications

value.title: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure with Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Migrate an ASP.NET web application to Azure with Visual Studio

topItems.title: Externalize configuration for your ASP.NET application using Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Learn how use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web application to retrieve secrets from Azure Key vault

topItems.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application, to store log data in Azure blob storage, and incorporate log information in Application Insights performance data.

topItems.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application using Azure Cache for Redis
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications

value.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: The objective of this learning path is to educate the learner how they can migrate SQL Server workloads to SQL Services that exist on Azure.

topItems.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a SQL Server database to an Azure virtual machine.

images.title: Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines

topItems.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a SQL Server database to Azure SQL Database.

images.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases

topItems.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a SQL Server database to an Azure SQL Database Managed Instance.

images.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances
Migrate SQL workloads to Azure virtual machines

value.title: Migrating Cassandra and MongoDB workloads to Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: This learning path enables students to migrate Cassandra and MongoDB workloads to Cosmos DB.

topItems.title: Introduction to open source database migration to Azure Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the learner will gain an understanding of Cosmos DB and the main considerations when migrating to Cosmos DB.

images.title: Introduction to open source database migration to Azure Cosmos DB

topItems.title: Migrate Cassandra workloads to Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a Cassandra database to the Azure Cosmos DB Cassandra API.

images.title: Migrate Cassandra workloads to Cosmos DB

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises MongoDB databases to Cosmos DB
topItems.excerpt: Learners will be able to demonstrate the benefits and processes for moving a MongoDB database to the Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB API.

images.title: Migrate on-premises MongoDB databases to Cosmos DB
Introduction to open source database migration to Azure Cosmos DB

value.title: Plan and implement a high availability and disaster recovery environment
value.excerpt: Data must be available when needed. Configure, test and manage a solution for high availability and disaster recovery using Azure tools and SQL Server tools.

topItems.title: Describe high availability and disaster recovery strategies
topItems.excerpt: Plan appropriate HA/DR strategy based on RTO and RPO. Choose best solution for IaaS or PaaS deployments or hybrid workloads.

topItems.title: Explore IaaS and PaaS platform tools for high availability and disaster recovery
topItems.excerpt: Deploy Windows Server Failover Cluster and AGs in Azure and hybrid environments. Configure temporal tables, geo-replication and auto failover groups.

topItems.title: Back up and restore databases
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement policy for recovering data in case of user error or failure of technology. Explore various options for how and where to backup and restore databases.

value.title: Planning Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you see how to plan for a deployment of SAP solutions on Azure. You will also consider the preparation required for migrating SAP workloads to Azure.

topItems.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will review the Azure infrastructure options for hosting SAP NetWeaver and S/4HANA systems in Azure. You will examine the differences between the offerings of traditional outsourcers and IaaS offerings.

images.title: Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture

topItems.title: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will review the SAP supported VM and HLI types, the OS and DBMS releases for SAP in Azure, and the SAPS throughput estimates provided by Azure VMs and HLI.

images.title: Planning for implementing SAP solutions on Azure

topItems.title: Prepare to migrate SAP workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will walk through the important steps required for deploying SAP workloads to Azure. The steps include project preparation, pilot, non-production, production preparation, go-live, and post production.

images.title: Prepare to migrate SAP workloads to Azure
Utilize Azure for SAP workloads reference architecture

value.title: Run Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: This learning path augments existing knowledge around the deployment methodologies for SAP workloads in Azure, focusing on Azure Marketplace and custom images using the Azure portal, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, and Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

topItems.title: Implement Azure VM-based SAP solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module examines the deployment methodologies of SAP workloads for Azure. You will review how to deploy Azure Marketplace and custom images using the Azure portal, Azure Resource Manager(ARM) templates, and Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

images.title: Implement Azure VM-based SAP solutions

topItems.title: Migrate SAP workloads to Azure
topItems.excerpt: You will see the difference between one-step and two-step migration. Also, you will learn how the Software Update Manager (SUM) tool can be used to create shadow repositories and target databases.

images.title: Migrate SAP workloads to Azure

topItems.title: Maintain Azure for SAP workloads
topItems.excerpt: You will review connection to Azure VMs running SAP workloads using public endpoints on a Jumpbox, VPN, or Azure ExpressRoute. You will also see how to back up Azure VMs using or more Azure VMs.

images.title: Maintain Azure for SAP workloads
Implement Azure VM-based SAP solutions

value.title: Scale AI in your organization
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you’ll get a high-level overview of how to manage an AI organization, team, department, or center of excellence. You’ll learn about fueling innovation at all levels, evaluating and prioritizing AI investments, establishing technical processes for AI, and distributing AI-related responsibilities across the organization.

topItems.title: Implement AI in your organization
topItems.excerpt: Everyone in an organization has a role to play in AI transformation. At the highest levels, leaders need to prioritize AI use cases strategically and create an environment where innovative ideas can flourish. Then, those ideas come to life and succeed long-term thanks to collaboration across lines of business and technical teams. This module provides insight into managing AI-related processes and responsibilities in an organization.

images.title: Implement AI in your organization

topItems.title: Start the machine learning lifecycle with MLOps
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we discuss best practices for creating and managing machine learning (ML) models using MLOps processes. MLOps is the practice of collaboration between data scientists, ML engineers, software developers, and other IT teams to manage the end-to-end ML lifecycle.

images.title: Start the machine learning lifecycle with MLOps
Implement AI in your organization

value.title: Access Metrics from your Azure Blob Storage Containers Programmatically
value.excerpt: Learn how to write C# code that accesses Azure Blob Storage metrics from Azure Monitor.

images.title: Access Metrics from your Azure Blob Storage Containers Programmatically

value.title: Add basic conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
value.excerpt: Learn to identify valuable information in conversations with LUIS for interpreting user goals (intents) and distill valuable information from sentences (entities).

value.title: Administer and manage Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine remotely
value.excerpt: You’ll be able to select and use suitable tools and techniques to remotely manage Windows IaaS VMs, and restrict administrative connections to those VMs.

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in education
value.excerpt: In education, decision-makers must take into account specific industry considerations before they can realize the true transformational power of AI. Educational institutions and organizations need to think strategically about AI—and they need to start today. To create real value, a comprehensive understanding of all the strategic components is required.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in education

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in financial services
value.excerpt: To realize the true transformational impact of AI in financial services, decision-makers must consider the special factors that apply only to their industry. To create real business value, a comprehensive understanding of all the strategic components is required.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in financial services

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in government
value.excerpt: In government, decision-makers must take into account specific public sector considerations before they can realize the true transformational power of AI. Government agencies need to think strategically about AI – and they need to start today. To create real value, a comprehensive understanding of all the strategic components is required.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create value in government

value.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare
value.excerpt: To realize the true transformational impact of AI in the healthcare sector, decision-makers must consider the special factors that apply only to their industry. To create real business value, a comprehensive understanding of all the strategic components is required.

images.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value in healthcare

value.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
value.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application using Azure Kubernetes Service using declarative manifest files.

value.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: GraphLab
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. GraphLab is a big data tool developed by Carnegie Mellon University to help with data mining. Learn about how GraphLab works and why it's useful.

value.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: MapReduce
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. MapReduce was a breakthrough in big data processing that has become mainstream and been improved upon significantly. Learn about how MapReduce works.

value.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: Spark
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. Spark is an open-source cluster-computing framework with different strengths than MapReduce has. Learn about how Spark works.

value.title: Dynamically meet changing web app performance requirements with autoscale rules
value.excerpt: Respond to periods of high activity by incrementally adding resources, and then removing these resources when activity drops, to reduce costs.

images.title: Dynamically meet changing web app performance requirements with autoscale rules

value.title: Externalize configuration for your ASP.NET application using Azure Key Vault
value.excerpt: Learn how use ConfigurationBuilder to dynamically configure an ASP.NET web application to retrieve secrets from Azure Key vault

value.title: Implement logging in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement logging in an ASP.NET web application, to store log data in Azure blob storage, and incorporate log information in Application Insights performance data.

value.title: Improve session scalability in a .NET Framework ASP.NET web application using Azure Cache for Redis
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Cache for Redis to store session data and improve the scalability of web applications

value.title: Audit the security of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
value.excerpt: You'll learn about Azure Security Center and how to onboard Windows Server computers to Security Center. You'll also learn about Azure Sentinel, security information and event management (SIEM), and security orchestration, automation and response (SOAR).
